isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - REMOVE - CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 9200i/9400i/9900i MODELS WITH PRO-SLEEPER® before APRIL 2000

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 9200 i/9400 i/9900 i MODELS WITH PRO-SLEEPER® before APRIL 2000

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 114 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i models with Pro-Sleeper® before April 2000 contains two air springs (bags) (Item 14), two shock absorbers (Item 8), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 1). The air suspension assembly (Figure 114) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air lines (to air spring) (Items 21 and 23), elbow fittings (Item 25), air springs (bags) (Item 14), height control valve (Item 1), shock absorbers (Item 8) and lateral control arm (Item 26) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 1), air springs (bags) (Item 14) and shock absorbers (Item 8) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para:

svcsubproc.title: Remove Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 1, Figure 114) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

step1.para: Drain air from air system.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 115 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull one of the air lines (to air springs) (Item 1) from "Y" push-in connector (Item 2) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3).
Repeat step 2. above to pull the other air line (to air springs) (Item 1) from "Y" push-in connector (Item 2) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3).
Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull "Y" push-in connector (Item 2) from "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3).
Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull air line (supply) (Item 4) from push to connect elbow fitting (Item 5) in "SUPPLY" port of the height control valve (Item 3).
Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull push to connect elbow fitting (Item 5) from "SUPPLY" port of the height control valve (Item 3).

Remove height control valve linkage (Item 6) from threaded ball pivot by unlatching linkage clip and carefully pry the height control valve linkage socket from threaded ball pivot on height control valve lever (Item 9).

figure.caption: Figure 115. Cab Air Suspension Height Control Valve

calloutgroup.callout1: 7. DRIVE BEARING NOTCH FOR VALVE ORIENTATION

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 114 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 3 and 4) and remove height control valve (Item 1) from cab mounting plate (Item 18).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 114 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 9 and 10) at the top and bottom of both shock absorbers (Item 8).
Remove shock absorbers (Item 8) from between cab mounting plate (Item 18) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 11).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)

step1.para: Drain air from air system.

warning.para: To Avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure air system is drained and be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 114 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 21) from push to connect elbow fitting (Item 25) at top of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 14).
Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull push to connect elbow fitting (Item 25) from driver side air spring (bag) (Item 14).
Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 23) from push to connect elbow fitting (Item 25) at top of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 14).
Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull push to connect elbow fitting (Item 25) from passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 14).
Remove retaining rings (Item 19) from stud at top of both air springs (bags) (Item 14).
Carefully raise cab for enough clearance to remove air springs (bags) (Item 14) as follows.
Use a suitable jack placed on frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame (Figure 106) .
Once the jack is positioned properly, carefully raise cab for enough clearance to remove top stud of air springs (bags) (Item 14) from cab mounting plate (Item 18).

caution.para: Over-raising of cab may cause component damage.

step1.para: Once the cab has been raised enough to allow top stud of both air springs (bags) (Item 14) to clear the cab mounting plate (Item 18), screw air springs (bags) off threaded studs (Item 27) of crossmember mounting plate (Item 11) and remove air springs (bags).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 114 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove lateral control rod (Item 26) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 12) and hex lock nut (Item 13) from mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 11) and lateral control rod (Item 26).
Remove hex head bolt (Item 12) and hex lock nut (Item 13) from cab mounting plate (Item 18) and lateral control rod (Item 26) and remove lateral control rod.
